{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3183020,"name":"Rick_McThunder","username":"Rick_McThunder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rick_mcthunder/{size}/124961_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T01:07:58.650Z","cooked":"

We are having an issue with disconnecting for 45+ seconds multiple times during matches at competition, we have attempted these changes

~ 3 different radios
~ removed barrel plug, running through POE into the closest port to the barrel on the radio
~ replaced VRM

Everything we have tested works over ethernet connection on the practice field even when slamming into the ground coming off the charging station, but once we put it on the field small jolts disconnect us for 45+ seconds still. We have gone through our code, but don’t see any errors, and added voltage limits to avoid brownouts.

Before pits closed we added a REV radio power module, as well as adding the barrel plug back to avoid any moments with no power to the radio, but will not be able to test this until our first match tomorrow. If this does not work we have another Rio imaged with code deployed to install, but only have one more qualification match for this to work. Is there anything that we could be missing?

Thanks in advance for any help that can be offered, we have flabbergasted ourselves, the CSAs and the FTA

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T01:07:58.650Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":46,"reads":323,"readers_count":322,"score":314.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Rick_McThunder","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28993,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3183030,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T01:38:04.627Z","cooked":"
Rick_McThunder:

Before pits closed we added a REV radio power module, as well as adding the barrel plug back to avoid any moments with no power to the radio, but will not be able to test this until our first match tomorrow.

Remove the barrel jack. The RPM has 18V output, which likely won’t play nice with the 12V from the VRM. Plus, it’s not legal - R616 specifies the VRM OR the RPM, not both.

Have you looked for other issues in the power pathway? Double check the RoboRio power. Double check the connection into the PDP and the main breaker. Double check the battery terminals. Those main power pathways should not move easily when you tug on them!

A couple of questions to help diagnose… Do you have anything else plugged into the VRM you were using, in any of the ports on it? Are you using bare wire into the WAGO terminals or ferrules, and if ferrules, are they round or square?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T01:59:37.158Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":88.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/2","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183062,"name":"Rotem","username":"Jizelda","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/b77776/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T01:54:14.410Z","cooked":"

45 seconds is about the time it takes for the router to turn on, so your router probably gets unplugged during the game.

From my limited experience it probably means that your router is in a bad spot, and when the robot experiences an impact the router gets disconnected.

I have seen it happening mostly when the router connection is perpendicular to the ground (honesty no idea way that would disconnect the radio)

You could try glueing the connections to the radio to ensure it won’t disconnect.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T01:54:14.410Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":232,"readers_count":231,"score":96.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Rotem","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54417,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"code electrical and strategy "},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/3","custom_user_title":"code electrical and strategy ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183069,"name":"Doug Frisk","username":"Doug_Frisk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/doug_frisk/{size}/125193_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T02:00:28.653Z","cooked":"

Go farther up the power chain. The Roborio is less sensitive to transitive power interruptions Than it used to be. A loose connection as far back as the battery cable is possible. Though the farther up you go, the less likely it is. Not impossible though.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T02:00:28.653Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":76.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Doug Frisk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22789,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The one with the practice field, Duluth RPC"},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/4","custom_user_title":"The one with the practice field, Duluth RPC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183073,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T02:11:54.672Z","cooked":"

I watched a couple of your matches… you’re disconnecting with practically no impact at all - in many cases, there isn’t another robot near you.

The last time I saw something similar to this it was an issue with the crimp in one of the 6 gauge cables going into the main breaker. Pull the electrical tape/heat shrink off those and make sure everything there is solid - the tape can sometimes hold it in after it’s pulled out of the connector, only barely making contact and allowing for easy disconnects. Check both at the breaker and the PDP.

It’s a long shot, but there is a rare (I’ve heard it’s something like 1 in 10,000) defect with the main breaker that can cause these sorts of symptoms as well. With the robot powered on, lightly tap the red button on the breaker - if the lights on the robot flicker, replace the breaker.

I suspect the problem is not at the radio itself, but elsewhere in the power pathway.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T02:11:54.672Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":191,"readers_count":190,"score":163.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/5","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183075,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T02:13:18.422Z","cooked":"

Another place to check is the fuses in the PDP/PDH. They should be pushed in HARD.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T02:13:18.422Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":80.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183106,"name":"Dom1279","username":"tobar23","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T03:30:33.534Z","cooked":"

We had a problem where comms kept randomly dropping at random intervals. Replaced a lot of things but in the end replacing the Rio did the trick, If you have an extra definitely give it a try.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T03:30:33.534Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":157,"readers_count":156,"score":61.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Dom1279","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56823,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183117,"name":"Rick_McThunder","username":"Rick_McThunder","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rick_mcthunder/{size}/124961_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T04:05:12.980Z","cooked":"

We disconnected one time from the charge station gingerly touching the ground, yet we have no problem sending it off on the practice field through ethernet. This is what has us so confused

Will do on the barrel jack.

We went through the power wires for our rio and found the ferrules to be a tad small, i will be going to our build room before comp in the morning to grab our set to put bigger ones on for better connection. will also grab an extra breaker and extra 6 gauge wire to replace what is currently on the bot if we find an issue.

That is all we have plugged in. We are using round ferrules.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T04:05:12.980Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":154,"readers_count":153,"score":70.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Rick_McThunder","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28993,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183177,"name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T07:23:47.651Z","cooked":"

I’d definitely make sure your main power wiring (between battery and PDP/PDH) is solid. In my experience most disconnections come from a loose wire in that area. Make sure everything is tight enough that if you wiggle it, it doesn’t move at all.

Your CSA should be able to help you determine from the logs if it’s the roboRIO or radio disconnecting. At ~45 seconds it could be either. That may help narrow down the cause.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T07:24:08.686Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":50.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Ari Meles-Braverman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/9","custom_user_title":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183183,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T09:45:26.146Z","cooked":"
AriMB:

At ~45 seconds it could be either

45 seconds is almost certainly the radio rebooting. The rio takes ~25-30. That said, it absolutely could be both, which would support a likely power issue somewhere in the common power lines (battery through PDP/PDH)

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T09:45:26.146Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":118,"readers_count":117,"score":28.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/10","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183184,"name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T10:00:39.827Z","cooked":"

Under normal circumstances yes, but I’ve seen it take longer especially if there are network issues or the team has a long process at startup

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T10:00:39.827Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":22.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Ari Meles-Braverman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":9105,"username":"Fletch1373","name":"Fletch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/11","custom_user_title":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183200,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T12:13:21.780Z","cooked":"
Rick_McThunder:

We are using round ferrules.

Round ferrules are bad. The wago connectors used with robot parts don’t grip them well, leaving a small contact area that can easily wiggle for momentary disconnects. I would recommend ditching the ferrules and going with plain wire into the wago’s, it’ll grip better and may solve your problem. There’s a local team that was having disconnects a few years back, once we removed their round ferrules the disconnects stopped and they’ve never gone back to them!

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T12:29:06.402Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":94,"readers_count":93,"score":28.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/12","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183280,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T16:47:23.435Z","cooked":"

It looks like you stayed connected in both matches this morning - did you identify the root cause, or was it a case of “we did a bunch of stuff and something worked”?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T16:47:23.435Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":72,"readers_count":71,"score":19.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/13","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183301,"name":"Nick Aarestad","username":"cadandcookies","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cadandcookies/{size}/158154_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T17:34:54.630Z","cooked":"

This is not necessarily true. We struggled with an intermittent power failure for the RoboRIO for both of our events. Due to not losing radio power, we investigated solely the power path for the RIO and were unable to fix it at those events. Further investigation at home revealed that the Radio + RPM was actually more resilient to intermittent issues with the main breaker than the RoboRIO was, and we were able to replicate the behavior with a known bad main breaker.

Running theory for us is that there’s sufficient capacitance in the RPM to insulate from extremely short losses of power, where that isn’t there for the RoboRIO. This isn’t really documented anywhere, but I figured I’d post about it publicly since it may assist others in troubleshooting similar problems.

On the topic of radio vs. roboRIO reboot, watch the RSL. If the roboRIO reboots, it will go off briefly. If only the radio reboots, the RSL will go solid on. I agree with the timing being suggestive of the radio rebooting, and second the advice to really check the primary power loop, plus wiring on all of the batteries.

We replaced the wire between the main breaker and the PDP, we also got rid of the barrel jack and relied on only the RPM. The CSA had the practice field radio configured for our robot so we could try it out over radio. Thank you for all the help!

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T17:57:42.683Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":61,"readers_count":60,"score":47.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":433337,"topic_slug":"robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match","display_username":"Rick_McThunder","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28993,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robot-disconnecting-multiple-times-during-match/433337/16","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183331,"name":"Doug Frisk","username":"Doug_Frisk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/doug_frisk/{size}/125193_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T18:30:49.534Z","cooked":"

You are correct, it is not necessarily true that on a specific robot the radio is more susceptible to transient power losses than the RoboRIO is. As a general rule though, over the past four or five years, the RoboRIO power has become more stable than the radio power.

In this specific case, the issue is absolutely a radio reboot issue and I stand by my statement that the issue causing the problem may be further up the power supply chain and the robustness of the current RoboRIOs may be masking an issue with power as far back as the main breaker as Jon suggested or even the battery cables.

That’s the fun and challenge of troubleshooting issues like this, you want to start with the likely issues but must never rule out the improbable ones.
